required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Day 3 Fresh Transfer Followed by Day 3 or Day 5 Vitrification of Supernumerary Embryos
clinical_study.official_title: Cumulative Pregnancy Rates and Direct Healthcare Cost Analysis of Two Different Strategies: Fresh Cleavage-stage Embryo Transfer (ET) on Day 3 With Vitrification of Supernumerary Embryos on Day 3 Versus Day 5

brief_summary.textblock:
This monocenter academic study aims to evaluate the effectiveness and cost effectiveness of two different strategies: fresh Embryo Transfer (ET) on day 3 followed by cryopreservation of cleavage-stage (Day 3) embryos versus blastocyst-stage (Day 5) embryos.
The primary outcome is the cumulative pregnancy rate after all transfers (fresh and/or frozen embryo transfer cycles which might take about 1 year), up to two sequential cycles. The secondary outcome concerns a cost analysis of both strategies from the healthcare payer's perspective.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Cumulative pregnancy is measured after two consecutive IVF cycles including fresh and frozen transfers which might take about 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The cumulative pregnancy rate after all transfers (fresh and/or frozen embryo transfer cycles)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cumulative pregnancy is measured after two consecutive IVF cycles including fresh and frozen transfers which might take about 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: cost analysis of day 3 and day 5 vitrification strategy

arm_group.description: Day of vitrification of supernumerary embryos is day 3
Day of vitrification of supernumerary embryos is day5

intervention.description: Supernumerary embryos after fresh transfer on Day 3 after oocyte aspiration are either vitrified on Day 3 or are kept in culture until Day 5 and vitrified on Day 5

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subfertile women planned for the first or second oocyte retrieval for in vitro fertilisation (IVF)/Intracytoplasmic sperm injection (ICSI) treatment
- who are older than 18 and less than 38 years old
- who have normal Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH) and normal Anti-Mullerian Hormone (AMH) levels
Exclusion Criteria:
- treatment with donor oocytes or donor embryos
- patients planned for Pre-implantation Genetic Diagnosis (PGD)
- Patients with BMI>30
- patients with endometriosis grade III-IV
